result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J Hershey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

  Def to undergo Sex Offender assessment and follow-thru with any treatment recommended.

Comply with sex offender registry.
.

to determine requirements of WI Stat 939.617(2)

Def w/Atty Simpson
Motion to determine applicability of WI Stat 939.617(2)
CRT: on the issue of whether it's an ex post facto law, if there was a say for you to determine that he had accessed his info all these years - that he committed the crime not now but back then, that would be another question, but that's not what we've got. Your ex post faction motion is denied.

from DA's office   re: Req to take off today & move to another date
Per Cindy, Br 1 - I will move it to Feb 18 @ 3 pm
to determine applicability/requirements of WI Stat 939.617(2) at sentencing
PSI PO is Barb Wuensch

Motion hearing at 01-27-2016 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 10:30 am.

3:53 pm Def in court w/Atty Araysa Marie Simpson.  Timothy Jon Gruenke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Simpson filed motions to reconsider and to suppress.  Gruenke:  The Court has already ruled on motion...   Nothing has changed to changed the rulling.  Simpson comments.  There's no infomation in the search warrant saying my client engaged in any activities post 2010.  He may have had a lifetime membership but that doesn't means he used it....
COURT:  The allegation is that in May, 2014, he had in his possession, child pornography.  He could have removed those images but he didn't.  The fact that the State may have waited, that's an argument for sentencing.  It doesn't change the motion to suppress.  The information provided to Judge Horne may have been old but the way this crime was perpetrated wasn't stale,  I think you have an argument at sentencing as to why the State waited.
Gruenke sites offer.  Plead to one count and the sentence to the Court.  Amended Information filed.
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No threats/force.
Count 1 - Possession of Child Pornography  948.12(1)(m) and 939.50(3)(d)  GUILTY.   Counts 2 & 3  Dismissed but read-in
COURT is satisfied that the plea is F, I & V made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
PSI due.  Set for motion hrg in January.  Then sent. hrg 60 days after.
Simpson states an alternative PSI will be done.
